alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 26 at 9:48PM PST until December 27 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...South winds will be increasing later tonight into early Tuesday morning, with sustained winds 20 to 30 mph and gusts 45 to 55 mph expected. Strongest winds will be 6 am to Noon Tuesday. A few gusts to 60 mph are possibe on the higher terrain, such as the Chehalem Mountains north of Newberg. Winds will become westerly later in the afternoon, and gradually ease into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia, Greater Portland Metro Area, Central Willamette Valley and South Willamette Valley. In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; South Willamette Valley
